intro: Humularia affinis, commonly known as the yellow-flowered flax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, narrow shape with a slightly hairy surface. Humularia affinis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
